name: unreal-log-viewer
description: A Visual Studio Code extension to view Unreal Engine logs received over a server port.

commands.title: Unreal Log Viewer: Apply Server Port Change
Unreal Log Viewer: Show Logs as Text for Copilot

unrealLogViewer.serverPort.description: The TCP port for the Unreal Log Viewer server to listen on. After changing, run the 'Unreal Log Viewer: Apply Server Port Change' command from the command palette to apply.

unrealLogViewer.useRelativeTimestamps.description: Display timestamps relative to the last log clear (e.g., +3s, +1m) instead of absolute dates.

unrealLogViewer.logTableFontSize.description: Font size for the log table content (e.g., '12px', '0.9em', 'var(--vscode-font-size)').

unrealLogViewer.useLogLevelColors.description: Enable custom color coding for log levels and dates in the log table. If false, all log text uses the editor's default foreground color.

unrealLogViewer.maxLogMessages.description: Maximum number of log messages to keep. When this limit is exceeded, the oldest 10% of messages are removed, and an internal message is logged.

unrealLogViewer.showGridLines.description: Show grid lines in the log table.

unrealLogViewer.logTableFontFamily.description: Font family for the log table content (e.g., 'Consolas', 'Courier New', 'var(--vscode-font-family)').

unrealLogViewer.copilotLogExportLimit.description: Maximum number of recent log messages to expose via the 'Show Logs as Text for Copilot' feature. Helps manage context size for Copilot. (Default: 1000, Min: 100, Max: 10000)
